title: Megan McKenna celebrates making it through to The X Factor: Celebrity live shows with luxurious cake
text:
Megan McKenna has revealed her joy at making it through to The X Factor: Celebrity live shows with a luxurious celebratory cake and more than a dozen cupcakes.

The former TOWIE star, 27, impressed the judges with her stellar performance of her original song Everything But You and will now take to the stage in the live shows.

Megan, who has long wished for a music career and previously released a country album, took to Instagram to mark the achievement after 'years of being turned away'.

Overjoyed: Megan McKenna, 27, has revealed her joy at making it through to The X Factor: Celebrity live shows with a luxurious celebratory cake and more than a dozen cupcakes

She said: 'I’VE MADE IT TO THE LIVES! Ahhhhhh! Is this really happening! Years of auditions, years of being turned away, years of singing my heart out at any opportunity to get to a moment like this.

'This is honestly A DREAM COME TRUE. And I can’t wait to show you guys so much more on this weeks live show! I can’t Thank you you all enough for your messages and support.

'Not just from now but from day 1 of you guys following me. Please please please remember to spread the love and vote for this is it. Let’s do this! I LOVE YOU.'

Megan also shared a clip of herself sipping on a beverage on board a plane as she made her way to Simon's house for the verdict.

Thrilled: Megan, who has long wished for a music career and previously released a country album, took to Instagram to mark the achievement

'I can't wait to get to Simon's house. Bring it on,' she said.

The reality star broke down in tears after being told she'd made it through to the live finals on Saturday's show.

Megan admitted she has taken the dramatic step of having her lip filler removed in order to be taken more seriously as an artist.

When she appeared on stage, Louis Walsh commented: 'You look different than the last time I saw you - what have you done?'

Celebrations: Megan shared a snap of her cake which featured a black base with yellow drip icing and matching rose-shaped icing on the top

Support: Megan also received several cupcakes that came with a small card that said #TeamMegan

Jumping to Megan's defence, Simon jumped in and said: 'What have you done [Louis]? You were bald when I met you 20 years ago.'

However Megan honestly admitted: 'I'm not gonna lie I used to have a lot of lip filler in my top lip and it was a bit embarrassing now I look back and I've had them taken out.

'I want to be seen as an artist so I can't be on stage looking like that, can I?'

Megan, whose song High Heeled Shoes reached number one on iTunes, previously auditioned for the civilians version of X Factor in 2014 and 2015.

After her audition, Megan took to Instagram and asked her followers to wish her good luck before she discovered she had made it to the live shows.

Audition: Megan impressed the judges with her stellar performance of her original song Everything But You and will now take to the stage in the live shows

She wrote: 'Tonight I performed one of the first songs I ever wrote. When I wrote this song 2 years ago I never would have thought I'd have the opportunity to perform it at judges houses in LA on The X Factor! This is honestly a dream for me. Wish me luck. Love you guys'.'

Ahead of the show airing Megan revealed it is difficult to be taken seriously as a music artist coming from reality TV.

She also admitted she doesn't feel she has an unfair advantage over her X Factor: Celebrity contestants despite having previously released an album.

Change: Megan admitted she has taken the dramatic step of having her lip filler removed in order to be taken more seriously as an artist

Megan is known for her appearances on other shows like Celebrity Big Brother and Ex on the Beach and believes people have a preconceived 'perception' of her that could be difficult to change.

She told MailOnline: ‘I feel like I’ve got a lot of pressure because I’ve been really trying to crack the music industry for a long time now.

'And I think coming off of reality shows, people have a perception of me and they judge me on shows I’ve done and it’s really difficult to be taken seriously.

‘So I feel like coming on this show, people can see how much this means to me and they will take my music seriously. That’s why I definitely wanted to do it.'
description: The former TOWIE star, 27, impressed the judges with her stellar performance of her original song Everything But You and will now take to the stage in the live shows.
